posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That's a tough call man,

This is one of the builds that you wish you had even a couple levels more to round things up, too bad we don't have that option. Between Ranger & Paladin there is a WIS synergy but nothing else and Ranger needs as many levels as you can get to work properly. Thankfully for you the Favored Enemies in a PvP arena are significantly fewer and you can perhaps afford to have only 5-6 of them. The build you linked from Tyr is good but i would change the weapon style and all because this build has no good AC for an arena fight. In fact let me re-shape it to a Ranger 23/ Rogue 2/ Paladin 15, take first level as a Ranger for more skill points, mix Paladin there as you see fit, take the two levels of Rogue only in Epics to keep your BAB to the highest. With your Ranger bonus feat take an additional FE and take Bane of Enemies (BoE) with a general feat. Starting with (STR 17  DEX 09  CON 12  INT 14  WIS 14  CHA 08) you need three Great STR to finish on a STR 30. Final attributes should be (STR 30  DEX 09  CON 12  INT 14  WIS 14  CHA 08) and your AC should be way higher.

Pre-epic feats: Heavy armour Proficiency (Free from Paladin), Blind Fight,Knockdown/ Improved Knockdown, WP: Exotic (to get the good forging bonses), WF, IC, Expertise, Toughness.

Epic feats: FE VI (Ranger bonus), Great STR III, EWF, EP, Armour Skin, BoE.

For weapons i recommend either a Katana/ Dwarven Waraxe or a Scythe, all the damage from BoE gets multiplied on criticals as well.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Another very nice option since you do have some available feats is to take Extend Spell, this is very crucial for Paladin's spells and especially Divine Favor because an extended version of it will probably last you for the entire fight (20 rounds), so probably take Great Fortitude & Extend Spell.

Darknight's suggestion is also cool if you have the skills to take advantage of HiPS, which you will probably have with 14 INT. You will need Dodge & Mobility for qualifying though.

posts.content:
Not a bad habbit at all darknight,

I have build and played up to level 25-30 lot's of builds that were pure rp or just fun myself and i never regret it ;)


Here is another idea for ya campgod, instead of going Ranger 23/ Rogue OR SD 2/ Paladin 15, you can also try Ranger 23/ Monk 1/ Paladin 16. Reason for that is that the 16th Paladin level gives you another second level spell slot that can be used for another extended DF (those +5/+5 bonuses are huge!), plus Monk gives you free cleave as well and also fits better due to the lawful theme of the build. Rogue it's probably still better though but we are talking about micro-details here, whatever you choose i hope you enjoy it.
